Probably not "directly", since that would mean grandma would have to have =
quite an understanding of digital encoding, including which bits mean what,=
 when, and where.=C2=A0 But even on a digital recorder, there is still an a=
nalog element (the Analog to Digital converter) which takes the sound press=
ure waves, as represented by some analog electronic detection element, and =
converts that into digital.=C2=A0 That way, long departed uncle Ebenezer do=
es not need to do anything digital.=C2=A0 Under this scenario, if sound is =
not being heard in the room, but is being induced into the circuitry, then =
it would be round about that AtoD converter (assuming it isn't other just p=
lain old noise in the digital elements).=C2=A0 

Someone with more electron=
ic know-how than me might be able to better pinpoint the area in the analog=
 portion of that AtoD pipeline where it would be most likely it could be in=
fluenced by, say, an EM field, and that would also occur in a normal analog=
 tape recorder.

=C2=A0

 Eric. Not 
and actual sound emitting a sound wave in the environment, but =
EMF manipulation 
in order to imprint the message directly to the recording=
 media. It doesn't 
matter if it is analog or digital.
=C2=A0
If the sound =
that is recorded emitted a 
sound wave in the physical environment, then it=
 is really a disembodied voice, 
and not true EVP.
=C2=A0

at they are there by giving off a EM field

ulate a magnetic strip of a tape or even the 
  electronics in a Digi recor=
der to speak in "real-time".

    2 different things 
    happening-that' s w=
hy. When you get EVP that everyone 
    understands,=C2=A0 it is outward, i=
n the environment. Not a 
    communication through subconscious means.
   =
 
    =C2=A0
    
    EVP that people swear 
    they hear, but noone else =
can make sense,=C2=A0may be a message to them via 
    subconscious means. =
That isn't to say that ALL EVP's like this are true 
    messages, I am sur=
e alot are just matrixing.
    
    =C2=A0
    
    But then that is how th=
e 
    art of scrying starts-matrixing. Like the Rorschach tests. The image=
s you 
    matrix with those gives the psychologist an insight into your 
 =
   mind.
    
    =C2=A0
    
    By gazing into a dark, 
    reflective su=
rface, you start to see cloudy images. At first, you will just 
    be matr=
ixing faces in the clouds and not getting much substance. Try it, you 
    =
will see what I am saying. With practice, you start to see clear, concise 
=
    images.
    
    =C2=A0
    
    I think=C2=A0that is 
    what=C2=A0ha=
ppening with audio as well.
    
    =C2=A0
    
    We already know for a =

    fact pareidolia can occur in audio as well as visual 
    stimulus.
  =
  
    =C2=A0
